patient_and_family_advisory_council_copy:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place monthly at 6 p.m. at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-690-7703
pricing_copy: See the cost of common services at Bay Park Hospital, including laboratory, radiology and physical therapy.
pricing_copy_clean_text: See the cost of common services at Bay Park Hospital, including laboratory, radiology and physical therapy.
volunteering_copy:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at Bay Park Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • Guest guides.
  • Gift shop.
  • Support services.
  • Patient care services.
  • Advisory councils.

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview prospective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 16 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPD 2-step/T-Stop (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of Flu immunization during the Flu season
  • Present proof of MMR immunization or a positive MMR Titer
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided at a ProMedica site free of charge.
  • Volunteers must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we are not equipped to handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum time and service commitment.
  • We’ll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that our departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Some departments will not accept volunteers under the age of 18.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our application at the link below.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

Apply Online

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Auxiliary

Our auxiliary is a group of dedicated individuals who volunteer for special events, fundraising, and projects that support our hospitals’ health and wellness mission. Consider joining us! For more information about our auxiliary, call 419-291-3648.

patient_and_family_advisory_council_copy:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place quarterly at noon at ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-436-6649

pricing_copy_clean_text: See the cost of common services at Fostoria Community Hospital, including laboratory, radiology and physical therapy.
volunteering_copy:
Do you want to do something hands-on to make a difference right here in Fostoria?

Renew your sense of purpose and brighten the lives of your Fostoria neighbors by volunteering at ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital. A friendly smile and a human connection may be all it takes to encourage someone’s commitment to better health.

Our volunteers perform many meaningful duties, including mail and flower deliveries and providing guidance at the information desk.

The ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Auxiliary is a group of volunteers that support our hospital’s mission — to improve the health and well-being of our community. We serve as a link between our hospital and our Fostoria area community by:

  • Raising funds for hospital equipment and services, which help the hospital maintain outstanding quality health care.
  • Offering area high school seniors and college students pursuing a career in a health care-related field the chance to get scholarships.
  • Coordinating events and volunteer opportunities.

Contact the auxiliary at 567-208-3702 or volunteer services at 419-436-6649 to explore your opportunities.

ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Auxiliary Scholarship

Annually, the Fostoria Community Hospital Auxiliary awards scholarships to local students. Click here for the scholarship application.

About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica Memorial Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place quarterly at 5:30 p.m. at ProMedica Memorial Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-334-6682

pricing_copy_clean_text: See the cost of common services at ProMedica Memorial Hospital, including laboratory, radiology and physical therapy.
volunteering_copy:
Volunteers are important members of the care team at ProMedica Memorial Hospital. Men, women, and students volunteer to do many tasks around the hospital, and are vital to our success, and the satisfaction of our patients.

Some of the areas where volunteers help around the hospital include:

  • Mailroom.
  • Patient transport.
  • Gift shop.
  • Hospice/home health.
  • Information desk.
  • Spiritual care.
  • Golden Threads office.

Volunteers work in most departments at the hospital, and can accept permanent, temporary or on-call roles. Our volunteer leader will work with you to find a role that works best for you.

To volunteer, you must be at least 16 year of age and have a written statement from your family physician verifying your physical and emotional well-being.

If you are interested in volunteering, download and complete the volunteer application below, or call the volunteer office. Volunteers are also required to go through a short interview with our volunteer leader. Volunteers will receive training and orientation from hospital employees or senior volunteers.

For more information, call volunteer services at 419-334-6609.

Download our Memorial Hospital volunteer application.

When ProMedica Memorial Hospital first opened its doors in 1918, a group of concerned women became actively involved with helping this non-profit institution provide quality care.

Since that time, the Auxiliary of ProMedica Memorial Hospital has financially assisted the hospital with major expansions and has continually supported many other projects .The auxiliary provides its support by raising funds and by providing services that help the hospital maintain outstanding quality health care.

Projects the Auxiliary of ProMedica Memorial Hospital has supports annually include:

  • Annual Health Education Scholarships – awarded to students pursuing a career in health care. Apply for the Annual Health Education Scholarship.
  • Main lobby renovations at hospital
  • Women’s Diagnostic Center Renovation (Digital Mammography)

The Auxiliary of ProMedica Memorial Hospital raises funds through:

  • Christmas Greeting Project
  • Browse-N-Buy Gift Shop
  • Book and Jewelry Sales

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

volunteering_copy:
You’re looking for a positive, rewarding experience. You want to lend a hand. Consider volunteering at ProMedica Monroe Regional Hospital!

Our hospital is grateful for the countless hours our volunteers share with our hospital. We are always looking to add individuals to our volunteer team that demonstrate a friendly personality, dependability, confidentiality, and a commitment to putting our patient’s needs first. If this sounds like you, I am eager to have you apply for our team!

Our volunteers are vital to the health and well-being of our hospital and our patients. Make a personal difference by donating your time and talents.

What do you do as a volunteer? Your help is much appreciated. You can perform meaningful tasks while connecting to patients and their loved ones. By offering your time and talents, you gain the sense of purpose and fulfillment that comes from giving back to your community.

As part of our volunteer team, services you can be a part of include:

  • Volunteering in our hospital’s gift shop.
  • Supporting our Pastoral care department.
  • Escorting patients, family members, and visitors within the hospital.
  • Assisting with Clerical duties.
  • Greeting patients and visitors as they arrive at our Welcome Center.
  • Visiting our patients.
  • Stocking medical supplies.
  • Driving patients to their cancer related appointments.
  • Fundraising and event support.

Apply Online

Download Application

patient_and_family_advisory_council_copy:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place bi-monthly at noon at ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-785-7301
pricing_copy: See the cost of common services at Defiance Regional Hospital, including laboratory, radiology and physical therapy.
pricing_copy_clean_text: See the cost of common services at Defiance Regional Hospital, including laboratory, radiology and physical therapy.
volunteering_copy:
Our volunteers make a difference in people’s lives everyday. At ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital, you can connect with patients and their loved ones and make their experiences easier.

You can volunteer in the following areas:

  • Beautiful Beginnings. The ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital Auxiliary sends a mailing to new and expectant mothers. This includes advice and guidance for pregnancy, birth, and the first year of their child’s life.
  • Coffee Cart. Hot specialty drinks and doughnuts are sold by our ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital Auxiliary from the coffee cart in our hospital lobby, Monday through Friday mornings.
  • Gift Shop. The gift shop is located next to the main lobby and is staffed and run by volunteers. Open Monday through Friday.
  • Information Desk. Direct visitors and answer questions from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m., Monday through Friday.
  • Surgery Desk. Help check-in patients before their procedures, notify the families when they are needed, and help to transport patients to the entrance. The surgery desk is staffed Monday through Friday.
  • Thrift Shop. We accept and sell used clothing, accessories, and home décor to raise funds for our ProMedica Regional Hospital Auxiliary projects and services.

Learn more about volunteer opportunities at ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital. Contact Gina Sheffel, volunteer and retail manager, at 419-783-6800 or at Gina.Sheffel@promedica.org.

Download our volunteer application.

patient_and_family_advisory_council_copy:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica Toledo Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place the second Thursday of every month from 6 - 8 p.m. at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-291-4000
pricing_copy: See the cost of common services at Toledo Hospital, including laboratory, radiology and physical therapy.
pricing_copy_clean_text: See the cost of common services at Toledo Hospital, including laboratory, radiology and physical therapy.
volunteering_copy:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at ProMedica Toledo Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • Guest guides.
  • Gift shop.
  • Support services.
  • Patient care services.
  • Advisory councils.

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview perspective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 16 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPD 2-step/T-Stop (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of immunity tetanus/diphtheria/pertussis or Tdap (Children's Hospital only)
  • Present proof of Flu immunization during the Flu season
  • Present proof of MMR immunization or a positive MMR Titer
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided by ProMedica Toledo Hospital free of charge.
  • Volunteers must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we are not equipped to handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum time and service commitment.
  • We’ll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that our departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Some departments will not accept volunteers under the age of 18.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our application at the link below.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

Apply Online

ProMedica Toledo Hospital and Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital Auxiliary

Our auxiliary is a group of dedicated individuals who volunteer for special events, fundraising, and projects that support our hospitals’ health and wellness mission. Consider joining us!

For more information about our auxiliary, call 419-291-3775.

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview prospective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Have a PPF 2-step/T-spot (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of immunity tetanus/diphtheria/pertussis or Tdap
  • Present proof of flu immunization during the flu season.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we cannot handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum service time commitment.

Steps to Volunteering

The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place quarterly at 5 p.m. at ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

volunteering_copy:
You can make a difference in the lives of countless people, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment through giving to our Coldwater, Michigan community.

Consider volunteering at ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital. We’re a group of dedicated men and women who foster fellowship among our members, serve as a link between the hospital and our community, and promote philanthropy. Volunteers serve many functions including:

  • Hospital fundraising.
  • Coordinating needed hospital volunteer services.
  • Purchasing needed hospital equipment.
  • Selecting members to serve on our governing executive board and special committees.

Call volunteer services at 517-279-5448
